about-me.title: About me

intro.label: I am a {quality-1}, {quality-2} and {quality-3} engineer, graduated in computer science. Initially destined for the paramedical field, I decided to go back to school at 22. I've discovered a passion for {interest-1}, and a great interest in JavaScript/TypeScript {interest-2} development.

about-me.future: My long-term ambition is to be able to join a project with a positive environmental/social impact to align my work with my personal values.

diploma-1.title: Computer Science Engineer specializing in AI/Big Data

content.label: In this French Tech start-up offering insurance for private customers (car, motorcycle, home), I had the opportunity to be part of the {italic-1} team, responsible for developing the internal tool for monitoring customer files and compensation in the event of a claim.

list.label: {item-1}{item-2}{item-3}{item-4}
list.item-1: Development in a demanding business context
list.item-4: Assisting junior profiles to improve their skills

content.label-1: Since Swizi is primarily a flex-office solution, it interfaces with the software components already present in its clients' buildings. In this context, I was responsible for developing IoT connectors and third-party services.
content.label-2: Since we collected a lot of building-related data (occupancy, counting, meetings...), it became obvious that we had to process this valuable information. I took the lead on the entire Data part and deployed it {italic-1} :

list-2.label: {item-1}{item-2}{item-3}{item-4}{item-5}
list-2.item-1: Setting up the Azure infrastructure and the datalake in 3 zones (gold, silver, and bronze)
list-2.item-2: Creating data retrieval pipelines in Synapse
list-2.item-3: Developing Python notebooks for data processing
list-2.item-5: Making it available via the {italic-2} solution

content.label: As part of my first professional experience, I joined Astek, a consulting company in the IT field. I was assigned to a client project in Vannes, where I worked as a developer within the Support team. This mission allowed me to operate on a wide range of technologies, from databases to Docker containers, and to face the functional and technical challenges encountered in a production environment used by many users.
content.label-extra: Thus, I was able to refine some additional skills:

content.label: To complete my engineering degree, I undertook a one-year apprenticeship at Nokia Lannion. The goal of my mission was to develop a proof of concept for a web solution in the form of a vulnerability dashboard to address cybersecurity needs.
content.label-extra-1: Starting from scratch, I had the opportunity to take part in the entire research and development process:

list-extra-2.label: {item-1}{item-2}{item-3}{item-4}
list-extra-2.item-1: Training a new team member on the project so they could bring the solution into production.
list-extra-2.item-2: Implementing a flexible access control system based on RBAC and ABAC concepts.
list-extra-2.item-3: Demonstrating our solution to colleagues based in the United States.
list-extra-2.item-4: Proposing an architecture allowing the addition of new features in the form of microservices.

content.label: During my 2-month internship at Ericsson, I worked on a web project in Java Spring Boot to develop a solution for managing test robots. I was part of a team of 4 people.
content.label-extra-1: The goal of the internship was to improve the testing solution, transitioning from tests limited to a single robot to a distributed testing solution involving multiple robots. This allowed me to deepen my understanding of concepts I already knew, such as:
content.label-extra-2: But also to discover new concepts such as:

list-extra-2.label: {item-1}{item-2}{item-3}
list-extra-2.item-2: Development using the Spring Boot framework
list-extra-2.item-3: Linking code and database via the Hibernate ORM

content.label-extra: Independent store selling mainly designer optical and sunglasses.

content.label: Development of a responsive and serverless web app that helps track and count points during a game of {italic-1}. Games are stored on Firebase and can be viewed in real-time by players.

Extraction of information from a dataset of 1000 songs, retrieved from the Spotify API, using analysis methods (CA, PCA, and MCA). The study focused on analyzing the relationships between the songs present on the top 100 metal albums according to the {link-1}.

In a team of 4, we had to train a neural network using different methods so that it could translate short sentences. We tried several architectures (LSTM, RNN, with or without dropout, with or without attention) and evaluated them using the BLEU score and the Word Error Rate.

A hands-on experience with a Graph database through the representation of railway data. The data was retrieved from the SNCF's Navitia API and inserted into a Neo4j database. The goal is to produce statistics on the interconnection of cities.

Creation of a recreational web app which tests one's knowledge of French geography. Questions are generated randomly and attempts are stored to, eventually, analyze and get insights from the collected data.
